intro: Amblystigma pilosum, commonly known as the hairy amblystigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptical in shape, with a velvety texture due to the dense covering of fine hairs. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and often display a range of colors from white to pink, attracting various pollinators.
